items.content: Hi Gabe, which threshold are you referring to? Are you talking about Privacy Threshold in SKAN?

more so for optimisation and learnings, what are our guidelines for the below?:


For some context, I’m keen to get across the most up to date TikTok guidelines regarding:

  • Threshold number
  • Most up to date details around thresholds:
    • Does each Ad Set or Campaign have to hit these daily thresholds, or is it at an overall account level?
    • If thresholds are met, are 100% of Reg and FTBs reported in Kochava for that day?
  • Are you able to provide the TikTok recommended best practice to approach measurement for iOS post install events?
  • Any other callouts.

 

ie. Threshold of 50 daily conversions for each event in app to be able to optimise towards, and is this at campaign level or ad group etc.

• Threshold number
    • General AEO (Android / iOS non-DC)
      • After 20-50 event conversions, optimization will improve, while CPA will reduce.
      • ​After 50 event conversions, the Learning Phase will end, and you will see efficient optimization.
      • https://ads.tiktok.com/help/article/app-event-optimization?lang=en#anchor-11
    • iOS DC AEO
      • Minimum of 50 installs/day/campaign
      • https://bytedance.larkoffice.com/docs/doccnHl9N4SplyXSG4pg7gk30Ib#Pyk9Yy
  • Most up to date details around thresholds:
    • Does each Ad Set or Campaign have to hit these daily thresholds, or is it at an overall account level?
      • For General AEO, it is at TikTok App ID level (An app registered in an each TikTok Ad account)
      • For iOS DC AEO, it is a daily threshold at the campaign level.
    • If thresholds are met, are 100% of Reg and FTBs reported in Kochava for that day?
      • I am not sure what exactly Reg and FTBs stand for. I am assuming Reg will be Registration but what does FTB stand for? First-Time Bet? I will answer your questions assuming these are type of in-app events.
      • All events for Android and iOS SKAN Opt-in data will be reported in Kochava regardless of TikTok's optimization threshold.
      • For iOS DC, there is a separate concept called 'Privacy Threshold' in Apple SKAN, not related to TikTok's optimization, which Apple will NOT report any app event until there is a number of events enough that cannot be tracked down to each individual user. If it is not met, App events will not be reported. (Exact number of Privacy threshold has never been disclosed by Apple. But, based on previous data, TikTok recommends advertisers to achieve 50+installs/campaign/day)
        • https://bytedance.larkoffice.com/wiki/wikcnj4EwJHFbKOhINObyH6oQrg
  • Are you able to provide the TikTok recommended best practice to approach measurement for iOS post install events?
    • I can see the advertiser is currently measuring Registration and First Bet only for iOS. Since there is some  capacity to configure something additionally in SKAN Conversion Values. Maybe they can try to measure the revenue amount, or add some additional in-app events.
    • What to measure will depend on what the revenue model is, what the KPIs are etc. I suggest you have a look at the slide below first (the slide is internal only) so you can understand the concept, and we can discuss more on what to recommend to the client after I understand more about your client's app.
      • https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/12gy4GiNXoBvmwdoktJ-ykav-QM9Ydaot9QlSQ6_P1zg/edit#slide=id.g22f14da8f16_0_3489
  • Any other callouts.

Threshold number

If thresholds are met, are 100% of Reg and FTBs reported in Kochava for that day?
